title: 'Alberta' wordmark font
content:
[Sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20140122135634/http:/commons.wikimedia.org/w/thumb.php?f=Alberta%20wordmark.svg&width=2000px)

Can someone ID this one for me? Thanks!
author: Nunymare

comments.content: I may be wrong, but I would guess that the logo was hand drawn. Maybe it's based on a bauhaus font.

I've always assumed it was hand-drawn too. You could try modifying Avant Garde.

- Lex
I was thinking that. Is there a possibility this is custom?

That's what we (or at least I) meant by hand-drawn. Back in the olden days, it would have been easier to use circle templates and rulers to create this than to try to modify an existing font.

- Lex

You can pretty much bank on this being a custom created logotype.

BTW: Alberta recently replaced this old logotype with a new version.

[http://www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/alberta\_scripts\_a\_ne...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140122135634/http:/www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/alberta_scripts_a_new_story.php "http://www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/alberta\_scripts\_a\_new\_story.php")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140122135634im_/http:/typophile.com/files/alberta_logo_3745.gif)
